page.title: 03BARCLAYS BANK AND WISBECH.
page.content: As in most large towns there is a branch of Barclays Bank situated in the Old Market,Wisbech.This building was opened in 1879 though not in the name of its present owners.It was in 1896 that Barclays took over the building when they amalgamated with the Wisbech and Lincolnshire Bank.This bank was founded by Jonathan Peckover in 1782 who had already bought a house on the North Brink.This house known as Peckover House and it is a most imposing building which dominates the river-side approach to Wisbech.Today the house is in the hands of the National Trust and is one attractions for visitors to Wisbech. Thus it is that an aspect of local history is linked with both a broader national story and a vital modern day amenity.
